name: header
label: Header
help_text: (Optional). A main header for this table. (NOTE: Recommended to use a separate 56 Section Header module for this header).

name: columns
label: Column Headers
help_text: Define the label and optional description for each column header of this table (up to 6 columns).

children.name: column_label
children.label: Column Label
children.help_text: The header label for the column.

children.name: description
children.label: Column Description
children.help_text: Optional. Add a description for your column label (if there is further context required).

name: rows
label: Rows
help_text: Define the label, cell details, and optional tooltip for each row in this table (up to 25 rows).

children.name: row_label
children.label: Row Label
children.help_text: The left-side label for the row content.

children.name: tooltip
children.label: Tooltip Content
children.help_text: (Optional) To enable a hoverable tooltip to appear beside this row's label, enter content in this field.

children.name: cells
children.label: Row Cells
children.help_text: The content for the row. The number of cells added here should correspond with the column headers in the table, in the same order.

children.name: content
children.label: Cell Content
children.help_text: The row content corresponding to the first column label in the table.

children.name: show_checkmark
children.label: Show checkmark?
children.help_text: In place of, or in addition to, content for this column cell, add a stylized checkmark (good for feature comparison tables).

children.name: header
children.label: Row Header
children.help_text: (Optional, use sparingly). A full-width header inserted before this row's cell content. This is called a merged cell header, and should act as a section header for the following rows.

name: scroll_helper_tooltip
label: Scroll Helper Tooltip
help_text: Helper tooltip text to show when table can be scrolled on mobile display.

name: footer
label: Footer
help_text: (Optional). Add text content immediately beneath this table (typically used for some form of disclaimer text).

children.name: background_theme
children.label: Background Theme
children.help_text: The background color theme for the module container.
